main_definition: Turbo refers to something that is characterized by high speed or power, often related to a device designed to increase efficiency or performance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An adjective describing an engine's ability to generate power at high speeds
meanings_and_examples.example: The turbocharged car accelerated quickly, reaching top speed in seconds.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A device that uses exhaust gases to drive a compressor and increase the efficiency of an internal combustion engine
meanings_and_examples.example: My car has a turbocharger, which helps it perform better on steep hills without losing power.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term used to describe doing something extremely quickly or with great energy
meanings_and_examples.example: I need to finish my work turbo this afternoon so I can go out for dinner later!
